definition[0]: to arrange for something to happen at a different time from the one that was previously planned
example[0]: The press conference had to be rescheduled for March 19.
definition[1]: to arrange for a debt to be paid back later than was previously agreed
definition[2]: to make new arrangements for the payment of a debt, loan etc, often because the person, company, or country owing the money cannot pay it back in the time agreed earlier
example[1]: Faced with mounting losses, the airlinerescheduled payments for its new aircraft.
example[2]: The company reached an agreement with its bankers to reschedule C$560 million in debt.
definition[3]: to arrange a new time or date for a meeting or event
example[3]: The shareholders meeting has been rescheduled for June 4.
